### What to do if a TMT ion mass changes:
```{r eval=FALSE}
# Load existing reporter converter:
reporter_converter <- PlexedPiper::reporter_converter

# In this example, we want to add a second mass option for all TMT sub-tables
#    except `tmt6` and `tmt10`
reporter_converter$tmt11_new <- dplyr::add_row(
    reporter_converter$tmt11,
    ReporterName = "131C_new", # Append _new to ensure unique reporter names.
    ReporterIon = "Ion_131.145",
    .after = 11 # Inserting in sorted order
)
reporter_converter$tmt16_new <- dplyr::add_row(
    reporter_converter$tmt16,
    ReporterName = "131C_new",
    ReporterIon = "Ion_131.145",
    .after = 11
)
reporter_converter$tmt18_new <- dplyr::add_row(
    reporter_converter$tmt18,
    ReporterName = "131C_new",
    ReporterIon = "Ion_131.145",
    .after = 11
)
# Re-save reporter converter:
save(reporter_converter, file = "../data/reporter_converter.RData")

# Re-build & Document
devtools::build(vignettes = F)
devtools::document()
```

### Test:
```{r}
data_package_num <- 6096

study_design_tables <- PlexedPiper::read_study_design(".") # Assume fractions.txt, references.txt, and samples.txt are in the current working directory
fractions <- study_design_tables$fractions
samples <- study_design_tables$samples
references <- study_design_tables$references

msnid <- read_msgf_data_from_DMS(data_package_num)
masic_data <- read_masic_data_from_DMS(data_package_num,
    interference_score = T
)

masic_data <- filter_masic_data(masic_data, 0.5, 0)
msnid <- apply_filter(msnid, "!isDecoy")

aggregation_level <- c("SiteID")
quant_cross_tab <- create_crosstab(
    msnid,
    masic_data,
    aggregation_level,
    fractions, samples, references
)
print(dim(quant_cross_tab))
head(quant_cross_tab)
```
